items.title: Trump, Zelensky say Ukraine peace deal edging closer but key issues unresolved
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday that talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were moving “very close” to an agreement to end the war in Ukraine, though both leaders acknowledged that major sticking points, including territory and security guarantees, remain unresolved.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday that talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were moving “very close” to an agreement to end the war in Ukraine, though both leaders acknowledged that major sticking points, including territory and security guarantees, remain unresolved.

items.title: Ukraine war live: Trump says Ukraine-Russia peace deal is ‘getting very close’ as he and Zelenskyy speak after meeting
items.standfirst: Trump says he and Zelenskyy have ‘made a lot of progress’ but that ‘one or two thorny issues’ remainThe Ukrainian military said on Sunday that it hit the Syzran oil refinery in Russia’s Samara region in an overnight drone attack.The strike caused a fire and damages were still being assessed, Kyiv’s General Staff said. Continue reading...

items.title: War in Ukraine: 'Sometimes you feel like the end is close, but every day it feels like far away'
items.standfirst: Volodymyr Zelensky is set to meet US President Donald Trump in Florida on Sunday (December 28) to discuss a 20-point peace plan aimed at ending Russia’s invasion. Ukrainian civilians are amongst those who have suffered most from Russia's war especially vulnerable populations. For more on that topic, FRANCE 24's Erin Ogunkeye is joined by Oleksii Starovierov, networks engineer at Chernihiv Rehabilitation Center for children with disabilities.

For more on that topic, FRANCE 24's Erin Ogunkeye is joined by Oleksii Starovierov, networks engineer at Chernihiv Rehabilitation Center for children with disabilities.

items.title: Trump says Ukraine peace talks in ‘final stages’ as he meets Zelenskyy in Florida
items.standfirst: Key topics include security guarantees to prevent Russia from attacking again, with US president saying he believes Putin is serious about peaceRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesDonald Trump has said talks to end the war in Ukraine are in their “final stages” as he sat down for a meeting on Sunday with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Florida, and insisted that Vladimir Putin was ready to make a peace deal.Trump met Ukraine’s president outside his Mar-a-Lago residence and claimed both warring sides were close to an agreement. Hours earlier the US president held a lengthy phone call with Putin and said he would ring the Kremlin again once talks had concluded. Continue reading...
items.content: Key topics include security guarantees to prevent Russia from attacking again, with US president saying he believes Putin is serious about peaceRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesDonald Trump has said talks to end the war in Ukraine are in their “final stages” as he sat down for a meeting on Sunday with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Florida, and insisted that Vladimir Putin was ready to make a peace deal.Trump met Ukraine’s president outside his Mar-a-Lago residence and claimed both warring sides were close to an agreement. Hours earlier the US president held a lengthy phone call with Putin and said he would ring the Kremlin again once talks had concluded. Continue reading...

items.title: Brigitte Bardot, 1960s French sex symbol turned militant animal rights activist, dies at 91
items.standfirst: Brigitte Bardot, the French 1960s sex symbol who became one of the greatest screen sirens of the 20th century and later a militant animal rights activist and far-right supporter, has died.
items.content: Brigitte Bardot, the French 1960s sex symbol who became one of the greatest screen sirens of the 20th century and later a militant animal rights activist and far-right supporter, has died.

items.title: Brigitte Bardot, French screen legend, dies aged 91
items.standfirst: Emmanuel Macron leads tributes to​ actor who became an international sex symbol ​and later embraced animal rights​ and far-right politicsBrigitte Bardot: a life in picturesPeter Bradshaw on Brigitte Bardot – a zeitgeist-force and France’s most sensational exportBrigitte Bardot, the French actor and singer who became an international sex symbol before turning her back on the film industry and embracing the cause of animal rights activism and far-right politics, has died aged 91.Paying tribute to Bardot on Sunday, the French president, Emmanuel Macron, wrote on social media that France was mourning “a legend of the century”. Continue reading...
items.content: Emmanuel Macron leads tributes to​ actor who became an international sex symbol ​and later embraced animal rights​ and far-right politicsBrigitte Bardot: a life in picturesPeter Bradshaw on Brigitte Bardot – a zeitgeist-force and France’s most sensational exportBrigitte Bardot, the French actor and singer who became an international sex symbol before turning her back on the film industry and embracing the cause of animal rights activism and far-right politics, has died aged 91.Paying tribute to Bardot on Sunday, the French president, Emmanuel Macron, wrote on social media that France was mourning “a legend of the century”. Continue reading...

items.title: 'She speaks to all kinds of generations': Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
items.standfirst: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before leaving the film industry to concentrate on animal rights activism. Bardot became a controversial figure in her later decades, with public comments and writing that led to five convictions for inciting hatred. For more on her career, FRANCE 24's Camille Knight is joined by Gad Edery, founder of the GADCOLLECTION gallery in Paris, that hosted an exhibition dedicated to Brigitte Bardot, a couple of years ago.
items.content: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before leaving the film industry to concentrate on animal rights activism. Bardot became a controversial figure in her later decades, with public comments and writing that led to five convictions for inciting hatred. For more on her career, FRANCE 24's Camille Knight is joined by Gad Edery, founder of the GADCOLLECTION gallery in Paris, that hosted an exhibition dedicated to Brigitte Bardot, a couple of years ago.

items.title: 'She was a cultural earthquake': Brigitte Bardot dies at 91
items.standfirst: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before becoming an animal rights activist and embracing far-right views. FRANCE 24's Manon Kerjean tells us more. "In her later years, Bardot became increasingly controversial due to her outspoken and radical political statements".
items.content: French film legend Brigitte Bardot has died at 91, the Bardot foundation announced on Sunday (December 28). Bardot starred in more than 50 movies during her career before becoming an animal rights activist and embracing far-right views. FRANCE 24's Manon Kerjean tells us more. "In her later years, Bardot became increasingly controversial due to her outspoken and radical political statements".

items.title: Bardot leaves controversial legacy of activism for France’s far right
items.standfirst: French cinema legend Brigitte Bardot, whose death at 91 was announced on Sunday, was well known for her status as a 1960s sex symbol. In later decades, Bardot became a militant animal rights activist and then veered to the far right, making disparaging remarks about the LGBTQ+ community, Muslims and immigrants that led to five convictions for inciting hatred.
items.content: French cinema legend Brigitte Bardot, whose death at 91 was announced on Sunday, was well known for her status as a 1960s sex symbol. In later decades, Bardot became a militant animal rights activist and then veered to the far right, making disparaging remarks about the LGBTQ+ community, Muslims and immigrants that led to five convictions for inciting hatred.

items.title: Thailand, Cambodia Declare Ceasefire After Weeks of Fighting
Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
items.standfirst: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.
items.content: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire agreement after weeks of intense fighting
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia have signed a ceasefire agreement to end weeks of armed combat along their border over competing claims to territory.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia have signed a ceasefire agreement to end weeks of armed combat along their border over competing claims to territory.

clusters.title: Video: Israel slammed for recognising breakaway region of Somaliland
clusters.neutral_headline: Video: Israel criticized for recognising breakaway region of Somaliland

items.title: Video: Israel slammed for recognising breakaway region of Somaliland
items.standfirst: Several countries and regional blocs have condemned Israel's recognition of Somaliland, a breakaway region of Somalia.
items.content: Several countries and regional blocs have condemned Israel's recognition of Somaliland, a breakaway region of Somalia.

items.title: Israel criticised after becoming first country to formally recognise Somaliland as independent nation
items.standfirst: Israel has been criticised after it became the first country to formally recognise Somalia's breakaway region of Somaliland as an independent nation.
items.content: Israel has been criticised after it became the first country to formally recognise Somalia's breakaway region of Somaliland as an independent nation.

items.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
items.standfirst: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...
items.content: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Louis Gerstner, CEO credited with turning around IBM, dies at 83
clusters.neutral_headline: Louis Gerstner, CEO credited with turning around IBM, dies at 83

items.title: Louis Gerstner, CEO credited with turning around IBM, dies at 83
items.standfirst: Louis Gerstner, who took over International Business Machines Corp. when it was on its deathbed and resuscitated it as a technology industry leader, died Saturday. He was 83. IBM chairman and CEO Arvind Krishna announced Gerstner’s death in an email sent Sunday to its employees, but didn’t provide…
items.content: Louis Gerstner, who took over International Business Machines Corp. when it was on its deathbed and resuscitated it as a technology industry leader, died Saturday. He was 83. IBM chairman and CEO Arvind Krishna announced Gerstner’s death in an email sent Sunday to its employees, but didn’t provide…

items.title: Lou Gerstner, the former IBM chief credited with turning the company around, has died at 83
items.standfirst: Lou Gerstner, the former CEO of IBM, has died at 83. James Leynse/Corbis via Getty Images Lou Gerstner, who led IBM's turnaround in the 1990s, has died, the company told staff. He kept IBM intact and refocused it on customers during a period of crisis. Gerstner reshaped IBM's strategy and culture…
items.content: Lou Gerstner, the former CEO of IBM, has died at 83. James Leynse/Corbis via Getty Images Lou Gerstner, who led IBM's turnaround in the 1990s, has died, the company told staff. He kept IBM intact and refocused it on customers during a period of crisis. Gerstner reshaped IBM's strategy and culture…

items.title: Louis Gerstner, man credited with turning around IBM, dies aged 83
items.standfirst: Louis Gerstner, the businessman credited with turning around IBM, has died aged 83, the company announced on Sunday. Gerstner was chair and CEO of IBM from 1993 to 2002, a time when the company was struggling for relevance in the face of competition from rivals such as Microsoft and Sun…
items.content: Louis Gerstner, the businessman credited with turning around IBM, has died aged 83, the company announced on Sunday. Gerstner was chair and CEO of IBM from 1993 to 2002, a time when the company was struggling for relevance in the face of competition from rivals such as Microsoft and Sun…

items.title: Lou Gerstner, a former IBM CEO and chairman credited with turning the company around, died at 83; IBM's market value rose from $29B to ~$168B during his tenure

items.title: Family pay tribute to man who died after assault outside Leicestershire pub
items.standfirst: David Darke sustained fatal injuries in incident outside the Crown Inn in Appleby Magna, police sayThe relatives of a 66-year-old man who died days after being punched outside a village pub have paid tribute to the “devoted family man”.David Darke, who died in hospital on Saturday, was injured outside the Crown Inn in Appleby Magna, Leicestershire, on 21 December. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Deadly clashes break out in Syria after Alawite mosque bombing
clusters.neutral_headline: Protests turn deadly during demonstration in Syrian city of Latakia

items.title: Deadly clashes break out in Syria after Alawite mosque bombing
items.standfirst: At least four people were killed and dozens more injured during demonstrations staged by members of the Alawite minority in Syria on Sunday. The rare protests followed Friday’s deadly bombing at an Alawite mosque in the city of Homs.
items.content: At least four people were killed and dozens more injured during demonstrations staged by members of the Alawite minority in Syria on Sunday. The rare protests followed Friday’s deadly bombing at an Alawite mosque in the city of Homs.

items.title: Protests turn deadly during demonstration in Syrian city of Latakia
items.standfirst: Fighting has broken out at a demonstration in the city of Latakia in Syria, killing at least three people.
items.content: Fighting has broken out at a demonstration in the city of Latakia in Syria, killing at least three people.

items.title: Andy Carroll to appear in court after arrest and charge for breaching order
items.standfirst: Carroll charged with breaching non-molestation orderFormer England striker due in court on TuesdayThe former England striker Andy Carroll has been charged with breaching a non-molestation order and is due to appear in court on Tuesday.Carroll, who was capped nine times by England and played for Newcastle and Liverpool, among others, was arrested in April after allegedly committing an offence the previous month. Continue reading...

items.content: Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England forward Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.

clusters.title: Guineans vote in first presidential election since 2021 coup
clusters.neutral_headline: Guinea votes in first polls since 2021 coup, military leader likely to win

items.title: Guineans vote in first presidential election since 2021 coup
items.standfirst: Guineans are voting Sunday in the country's first election since 2021, when the head of the ruling junta, General Mamady Doumbouya, seized power in a coup d'état.
items.content: Guineans are voting Sunday in the country's first election since 2021, when the head of the ruling junta, General Mamady Doumbouya, seized power in a coup d'état.

items.title: Guinea votes in first polls since 2021 coup, military leader likely to win
items.standfirst: Mamady Doumbouya may win amid accusations of restrictions on the media and the opposition parties.
items.content: Mamady Doumbouya may win amid accusations of restrictions on the media and the opposition parties.
